medical_history.chief_complaint: Renal insufficiency and familial apolipoprotein A-I amyloidosis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The first patient was diagnosed with renal insufficiency in January 1996 at age 57. The second patient was diagnosed in June 1996 at age 50 with the mutant Arg26 Apo A-I protein. Both experienced varying degrees of renal dysfunction at diagnosis, with symptoms progressing over time.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Both patients were diagnosed with familial nephropathic systemic amyloidosis. The first patient had a history of breast cancer (treated with lumpectomy, radiation, and chemotherapy) and underwent combined liver and kidney transplantation. The second patient underwent nephrectomy for a papillary renal cell carcinoma incidentally discovered during evaluation.
medical_history.family_history: The first patient's father died of chronic renal disease at age 42, and a cousin died at 43 with renal disease and hepatic failure. Affected family members had the same glycine to arginine mutation at Position 26 in the Apo A-I protein.
